results.name: Generalized Bernoulli numbers B_n(X,0), X a Dirichlet character modulus 8.
comment: Let X be a periodic arithmetical function with period m. The generalized Bernoulli polynomials B_n(X,x) attached to X are defined by means of the generating function

The values B_n(X,0) are generalizations of the Bernoulli numbers (case X = 1). For the theory and properties of these polynomials and numbers see [Cohen, Section 9.4]. In the present case, X is chosen to be the Dirichlet character modulus 8 given by
The odd-indexed generalized Bernoulli numbers B_(2*n+1)(X,0) vanish. The current sequence lists the even-indexed values B_(2*n)(X,0).
The coefficients of the generalized Bernoulli polynomials B_n(X,x) are listed in A151751.
reference: H. Cohen, Number Theory - Volume II: Analytic and Modern Tools, Graduate Texts in Mathematics. Springer-Verlag.
formula: The sequence of generalized Bernoulli numbers
a(n) = (-1/2)*16^n*n*euler(2*n-1, 1/4) for n >= 1 after a formula of _Peter Bala_ in A000464. - _Peter Luschny_, Nov 26 2020
